9C53194F4E324B3A91935D074794F3A6.description: Use general academic and domain specific words and phrases accurately.

298BDB4163644923A74BFC5520257192.description: Use grade appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases accurately within writing.

2C5CE2D6DAB545D4B14FD5E44FBFED3B.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when
considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

B01613A1F8E04B4193B3B8CDDCAC76A4.description:
Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., bullheaded, willful,
firm, persistent, resolute).

B9C82DF53EB94383BCFE1A7C791B04EE.description: Use the relationship between particular words to better understand each of the words.

DFB7A557C1164627A01711731182B28A.description: Use literacy devices (e.g., similes, metaphors, hyperbole, personification, imagery) in narrative writing.

AF412898FA27463899EBD17A51476082.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., allusions, verbal irony, puns) in context.

9767F9657E0A4110AFD59051CF2F7B4B.description: Identify a pun within a text or media.

1443449A7CCA4A46B6FF80044F95AC09.description: Identify irony within a text or media

8AF54A9BD5DC4F88952147E60F4535B7.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
a. Interpret figures of speech (e.g. verbal irony, puns) in context.
b. Use the relationship between particular words to better understand each of the words.
c. Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., bullheaded, willful, firm, persistent,
resolute).

9B08F56FF2D4459394074CC9BE5075BF.description: Verify the prediction of the meaning of a new word or phrase (e.g., by checking a dictionary).

2C91515B3A03409DBD07F584B6E5B3B4.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the precise meaning of a word.

A3D9BA9A44A74554B2E7A800BC3E86E8.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the synonym for a word.

A64F0369EF044A889AE3675F9E5ECEA3.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the pronunciation of a word.

156C183ED8084921A099F82FA378B53A.description: Use context as a clue to the meaning of a grade-appropriate word or phrase.

B6F0233D15A845CBAB82BD5CC8A8360F.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words or phrases based on grade 8 reading and content, choosing flexibly
from a range of strategies.
a. Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., precede, recede, and secede).
b. Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a
word or phrase.
c. Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the
pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.
d. Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase.

2C9216385164470DB385B487F5707E9F.description: Use verbs in the conditional and subjunctive mood to achieve particular effect.

A89F0F4E7E4F4C4F88C846D966E55DD8.description: Use active and passive voice in writing to achieve particular effect.

9A59191BA98A427F9ED64F6CBBFF4E1D.description:
Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.
a. Use verbs in the active and passive voice and in the conditional and subjunctive mood to achieve particular effects (e.g., emphasizing the
actor or the action; expressing uncertainty or describing a state contrary to fact).

18BA93BA567D4A69922916DB392BBC63.description: Use punctuation (e.g., comma, ellipsis, dash) to indicate a pause or break.

7EEBEFB421D84C49AC076D6CD5FF7286.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
a. Use punctuation (comma, ellipsis, dash) to indicate a pause or break.
b. Use an ellipsis to indicate an omission.
c. Use correct spelling.

EB61CAF1B4D947E39AE4E498315D9265.description: Use verbs in indicative, imperative, interrogative, conditional, and/or subjunctive mood in writing.

0B655B8B1FE74426B41BC80EF8791CEE.description: Use active and passive verbs in writing.

8A266E8B4D4546E6A497C24B26C3A3BA.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or
speaking.
a. Explain the function of verbals (gerunds, participles, infinitives) in general and their function in particular sentences.
b. Form and use verbs in the active and passive voice.
c. Form and use verbs in the indicative, imperative, interrogative, conditional, and subjunctive mood.
d. Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verbals, voice, and mood.

688BD246580946259B910FB9A28E3001.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

24EAF52744E9467C9F5540ECA9943265.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when
indicated or appropriate. (See grade 8 Language standards 1 and 3 for specific expectations.)

A1CF3814C45641A89A88B056B622A905.description:
Include multimedia components and visual displays in presentations to clarify claims and findings and emphasize salient
points.

6C9C137C13F74535A31A6E5FFF083D8A.description: Integrate multimedia and visual displays into presentations to clarify information, strengthen claims and evidence, and add interest.

FF56D32D47CC4494BB3101A5D3AE4E27.description:
Report on a topic, with a logical sequence of ideas, appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details which support the main
ideas.

77A7B2E5209E42B3AF7FCC764CF3A6F3.description: Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a coherent manner with relevant evidence.

75A5C9FC97644744B7D65C89F13DE3A9.description: Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with relevant evidence, sound valid reasoning, and wellchosen details; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

48259A7D5A8A4DAB8CA0A12E36062C51.description: Evaluate the soundness or accuracy (e.g., multiple sources to validate information) of reasons presented to support a claim.

8144C6CD803C4E44A48D98A19212C013.description: Identify when irrelevant evidence is introduced within an argument.

E1537B3762314E77975C0F111C3C6E10.description: Evaluate the soundness of reasoning and the relevance and sufficiency of evidence provided in an argument.

315DF6D696D8402AA401D634AA8311C8.description:
Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and relevance and sufficiency of the evidence
and identifying when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

BAB5957D442646EA8D8B24BAD5D66218.description: Evaluate the motives and purpose behind information presented in diverse media and format for persuasive reasons.

AEF575EDB1444B59881478416C3F0CB8.description:
Identify the motives behind information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, personal communication,
periodicals, social media).

23435D569E4E4829BEDB23966A29D379.description:
Analyze the purpose of information presented in diverse media (e.g., visually, personal communication, periodicals, social
media).

590291D18F8949CCB6B824A649EEBE8B.description:
Analyze the purpose of information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and evaluate the motives
(e.g., social, commercial, political) behind its presentation.

CFC10D508F1B499884092C4067EF0DBD.description: Discuss how own view or opinion changes using new information provided by others.

5F5DCD2EB0304F58AC1D004921A6FD6B.description: Use information and feedback to clarify meaning for readers.

91AADA6350D2414DBF935DCDCE243214.description: Use information and feedback to refine understanding.

0D25EE3CEBF64818809E12C33CC77570.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 8 topics,
texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.
a. Come to discussions prepared having read or researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence
on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.
b. Follow rules for collegial discussions and decision-making, track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as
needed.
c. Pose questions that connect the ideas of several speakers and respond to others' questions and
comments with relevant evidence, observations, and ideas.
d. Acknowledge new information expressed by others, and, when warranted, qualify or justify their own views based on the evidence
presented.

0C9E65D40B28475195B9344C2F90183B.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

2382FB3DE571474F9349B06C8B08C39B.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two)
for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

5A6A855A898B4B38A3AFE200F24F2763.description: Provide evidence from grade appropriate literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

9EC94FA615D24A5BAB3A4677AA308EFD.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
a. Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literature.
b. Apply grade 8 Reading standards to informational text and nonfiction.

7F37F2B678D44B6ABA80578109BE4E3B.description: Use a standard format to write citations.

056B8456B5AA405C96D0CC3CF5B2988A.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others in writing while avoiding plagiarism.

B9ABEE4AEC7541FBB82AED38EC78B8EC.description:
Gather relevant information (e.g., highlight in text, quote or paraphrase from text or discussion) from print and/or digital
sources.

21FECF3F6AD7426B95E586F09DF861A4.description: Use a standard format to produce citations.

AEEE3C866FDA4C18894D97FEC6D34B9D.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others in writing while avoiding plagiarism.

A5C5FF7C76B346AF85490F1766F74D1C.description: Gather information (e.g., highlight, quote or paraphrase from source) relevant to the topic from print and/or digital sources.

E6ED743940BD4587889B04F1056029E3.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each
source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

8C5374B0011F47BD82263BDB03C74966.description:
Follow steps to complete a short research project (e.g., determining topic, locating information on a topic, organizing
information related to the topic, drafting a permanent product).

2F8CDE2855DF4BD08C927ACA1ACA5F71.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question), drawing on several sources and generating
additional related, focused questions that allow for multiple avenues of exploration.

492E5BF496DD4793A83799D66F6644D4.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

D3992574A9E143F99D620A25C6965A0C.description: Use technology to produce and publish writing (e.g., use word processing to generate and collaborate on writing).

48B7419FCC4D400ABA756EA095F2C371.description:
Use technology, including the internet, to produce and publish writing and present the relationships between information and ideas efficiently
as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

5EFC291A620F4F0EA281C2C03CF69750.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising and editing.

14571564495F4B5CACF60C1E5C4AFB2E.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising and editing (e.g., review product,
strengthening story).

8255FE93EC1B420BA171ECD0AF62E933.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising and editing.

563526FB73C24649B73CEEA677E0A108.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing (e.g., determine the topic, gather information,
develop the topic, provide a meaningful conclusion).

675A3023C3ED48369B25D22672F3F5EA.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing (e.g., choose a topic, introduce story elements,
develop storyline, conclude story).

7007DA1F37E048D4A237746308632369.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing (e.g., define purpose, which is to persuade, state
your claim, gather evidence, create your argument, provide a meaningful conclusion).

290BC927411E42128BFB81D5299FB36A.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or
trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate
command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including grade 8.)

8DB53743BC87467DB74C13B5E671A188.description:
Produce a clear, coherent, permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task, purpose (e.g., to persuade), and
audience.

66769D06E06F4BD19D63BF2AA68780CA.description:
Produce a clear, coherent, permanent product) that is appropriate to the specific task, purpose (e.g. to entertain), and
audience.

8BB8A6B57F534252B68EB1BF5CDD87EF.description:
Produce a clear, coherent, permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task (e.g., topic), purpose (e.g., to inform), and
audience (e.g., reader).

E63C7D19DCBC486DAACFC71053692928.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Gradespecific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

BADF860F09F543239857FFAFEA3DBF7B.description: Use literacy devices (e.g., similes, metaphors, hyperbole, personification, imagery) in narrative writing.

2A7124F4D8BE4A8BB64D271BBB40FAD0.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

DD41E377EE794646A51F01644AEE18F3.description:
Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey
experiences and events.

67BB55DE8DD846B1A99A64A899DA1129.description:
Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence, signal shifts from one time frame or setting to
another, and show the relationships among experiences and events.

2741C33A6BA24CF2A0920B963F45B241.description:
When appropriate use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or
characters.

A3A10A67054545EEB227C8EBEF37D228.description: Organize ideas and event so that they unfold naturally.

C436C6DC246941738376535B23708004.description: Orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters.

062F38790E6C4F34ABD06B233D633251.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured
event sequences.
a. Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event
sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.
b. Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, and reflection, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.
c. Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence, signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another, and show
the relationships among experiences and events.
d. Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.
e. Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

5C6A47F949614CB9A8820A1AE434BF1C.description:
Report on a topic with a logical sequence of ideas, appropriate facts, and relevant, descriptive details which support the main
ideas.

FE1C387122D44476AC8BC461980B7698.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented.

D75E08D8692D46A3A98C7B91484AA17F.description: Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a coherent manner with relevant evidence.

A296C87FD1984561AA16D0168FB60C36.description: Maintain a consistent style and voice throughout writing.

7E620AFE0DB64E2983FDB8B7DE639C7B.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

2ED803EC45274E03AE7186AA8C6944AD.description: Use transitional words, phrases, and clauses that connect ideas and create cohesion within writing.

899E68FCAA9042E386AA458BC21A0BC2.description:
Develop the topic (e.g., add additional information related to the topic) with relevant, well-chosen facts, definitions, concrete
details, quotations, or other information and examples.

CB2B56E8A3DB41A8A497922D5DA564BC.description: Write an introduction that clearly previews information to follow and summarizes stated focus.

CC9F1C05C6BA44D7ABAEA9948ADF9FFD.description:
Create an organizational structure for writing that groups information logically (e.g., cause/effect, compare/contrast,
descriptions and examples), to support paragraph focus.

487B7C708D874C4CBECC7C3D6020FCDC.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information
through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.
a. Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information
into broader categories; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and
multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.
b. Develop the topic with well-chosen, relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or
other information and examples.
c. Use appropriate and varied transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among
ideas and concepts.
d. Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.
e. Establish and maintain a formal style.
f. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or
explanation presented.

1431B8F865B245E5875CED6C86489817.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that supports and summarizes the argument presented.

2F707EA1A3D3449795AB82A4571C90D2.description: Maintain a consistent style and voice throughout writing.

BCEC543B6DCD4CC282DF6B6821B1BBAD.description: Use words, phrases and clauses to link opinions and reasons and clarify relationship of ideas.

BADF4359EC8E434DA0C7769A8A944C1D.description: Write arguments to support claims with logical reasoning and relevant evidence from credible sources.

09A6774B9C70417FB81AFA75301C66BF.description: Create an organizational structure in which ideas are logically grouped to support the writer's claim.

0851713B930243D2B64782A7EE26B2F0.description: Write an introduction that introduces the writer's claims and distinguishes it from alternate or opposing claims.

94535829246C4CDBB4A694C0C60C6B09.description:
Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.
a. Introduce claim(s), acknowledge and distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence
logically.
b. Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate, credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the
topic or text.
c. Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.
d. Establish and maintain a formal style.

0811AFC76F2644B381D38103690E7F4E.description:
Use a variety of strategies (e.g., use context, affixes and roots, use reference materials to derive meaning from a variety of
print/non-print texts.

6F299D754E1141B88FF70811A6D1DEEF.description:
Read or be read to a variety of texts including historical novels, periodicals, dramas or plays, poetry (including soliloquies
and sonnets), fiction and nonfiction novels.

703406F5C8B74D398F6CCE1BCAA90F32.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend informational texts and nonfiction in a text complexity range
determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 8.

1C9BA226680E4261AA14BB064C1909A0.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

07E3AE137F294B91826BC2574EB066C0.description:
Analyze a case in which two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same topic and identify where the texts
disagree on matters of fact or interpretation.

62B6FC67240842E889F6AA33B23AF907.description:
Analyze a case in which two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same topic and identify where the texts disagree on matters
of fact or interpretation.

912E91C0781A40DCAA6416CA26E0BE78.description: Evaluate the claim or argument to determine if it is supported by evidence.

D222BCE876D8423287A59B6C7894D86B.description: Identify an argument or claim that the author makes.

8FF362CB16DB4AD782C51C0C62C8ABE5.description:
Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and
sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

95FA305BB0194CF9B964E65AA3E9C91D.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

1CCD7B4EA58D4B8C9FC0CDF10E2DCDDB.description:
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using different mediums (e.g., print or digital text, video, multimedia) to present a particular
topic or idea.

01DBDC10BE5947C69C4B607A4F99F3EA.description:
Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author acknowledges and responds to conflicting
evidence or viewpoints.

C36C0635CD0F4CE1AEA9635CE6B0353C.description:
Determine an author's point of view, perspective and purpose in a text and analyze how the author acknowledges and responds to conflicting
evidence or viewpoints.

93401B33499143BA82EFED56785AB1D9.description: Outline the structure (i.e., sentence that identifies key concept(s), supporting details) within a paragraph.

7DFBDAE4FDCA42C19AEA49318C344862.description: Use signal words as a means of locating information.

2ADD40E6392142078BFD5479CD67D317.description: Determine how the information in each section contribute to the whole or to the development of ideas.

077DD1D345264005B9D976110C49A09A.description: Determine the structure of a text.

9F287D0ECE274DB196EA4D49B7D9F1AC.description:
Analyze in detail the structure of a specific paragraph in a text, including the role of particular sentences in developing and refining a key
concept.

724B3A4AFC814B01B30A3A3431D303FB.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text including figurative (i.e., metaphors, similes, and
idioms) and connotative meanings.

2CB40CD13FCD418ABDA9C244040BD9AE.description: Analyze how the use of figurative, connotative or technical terms affects the meaning or tone of text.

B7F9C05D24744ABF86BDB1A1620B34C3.description: Identify and interpret an analogy within a text.

BA8BC290F5AD444F9F261A444F3C3F7A.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the
impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

8FE98AFD18A341FDB439139C6E4AAA7D.description:
Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through
comparisons, analogies, or categories).

76F837BB4A8044E3A25B09BBD05D34B8.description:
Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or
categories).

40E2D168BEFB4F7F9DA55D3D02907449.description: Provide/create an objective summary of a text.

7AA13FA01E794A5C88C56EE4AF5DFAE3.description: Analyze the development of the central ideas over the course of the text.

E8E722A563834AA880E6BE2283FB6EEA.description: Determine two or more central ideas in a text.

4B4FF1A1093C43839D9E3189C7636BE2.description:
Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to supporting ideas;
provide an objective summary of the text.

54BF5592FC5742FA93B7EC0CD8EABB4B.description: Determine which piece(s) of evidence provide the strongest support for inferences, conclusions, or summaries or text.

172EC567BE604BBBBCCC66F535C3A60F.description: Use two or more pieces of evidence to support inferences, conclusions, or summaries of text.

6B229F2D1E17461EA62FE0108E96523E.description: Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

5FD9AF5FC2754540992DA78F10E6A729.description: Use a variety of strategies to derive meaning from a variety of texts.

2162F9F674B4441B89C886E53277F4CD.description:
Read or be read to a variety of texts or adapted texts including historical novels, periodicals, dramas or plays, poetry
(including soliloquies and sonnets), fiction and nonfiction novels.

66A0D40D6BB848B79D481A204ECC0242.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas and poetry, in a text
complexity range determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 8.

B39C7145E9894EDBAA16FD0A1E264C8C.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

F5AE8D432E0B458883650F7C39A37BEE.description: Compare modern works of literature to the texts from which they draw ideas.

1D269A22DFDA48E2B96A10206A1DB68B.description:
Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional stories or religious
works, including describing how the material is rendered new.

8A78164490F340B2AF0B65E9BDCA12DD.description: Compare and contrast content presented in text, media, and live performance.

FE648B41F1004002ABDF93064E6D1150.description:
Analyze the extent to which a filmed or live production of a story or drama stays faithful to or departs from the text or script, evaluating the
choices made by the director or actors.

F491C0DF250C4D598677F2ABF2D7894C.description:
Analyze how differences in points of view of the characters and the audience or reader (e.g., created through the use of dramatic
irony) creates such effects as suspense or humor.

0FC6A5E5BE1A4282A0313D44BEBEB013.description:
Analyze how differences in the points of view of the characters and the audience or reader (e.g., created through the use of dramatic irony)
create such effects as suspense or humor.

C7BA74AA13424E8DAE890D6F467129D2.description: Explain how language use contributes to the meaning of a poem or drama.

8E32C4AA651A491C873812D6716E9E47.description: Compare and contrast the structure of two or more texts.

DFC90E7536214EB1B9B0443280838CC4.description:
Compare and contrast the structure of two or more texts and analyze how the differing structure of each text contributes to its meaning and
style.

2418467078D44D64A17B3A31ED84C645.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text including figurative (i.e., metaphors, similes, and
idioms) and connotative meanings.

FC91029911E24CA6BB2ABE66382CB26C.description: Identify and interpret an analogy within a text.

6F3EC147BA304B1398789012686EF2F8.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of
specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

E556449B5D384A9F8F372498862EE8D3.description: Explain how the use of literary techniques within a text advances the plot or reveal aspects of a character.

93E3B76D3B66491CBD4A2F6F7FBEB221.description: Identify the use of literary techniques within a text.

AEDBA5A7F5634B26885C6D2B579164BB.description:
Analyze how particular lines of dialogue or incidents in a story or drama propel the action, reveal aspects of a character or
provoke a decision.

E6D39D7C9FF541799246D35300A3EF49.description: Analyze how particular lines of dialogue or incidents in a story or drama propel the action, reveal aspects of a character, or provoke a decision.

C4D6402DC52F4E61AF4451357E7356AF.description: Provide/create an objective summary of a text.

341FA3F8BEF4434388A80367DF634587.description:
Analyze the development of the theme or central idea over the course of the text including its relationship to the characters,
setting and plot.

F3C6DA50DE8941E0BAEE75E68EC5ADCE.description: Determine the theme or central idea of a text.

9AD8B716BEDC44ECAFA286002CF38556.description:
Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to the
characters, setting, and plot; provide an objective summary of the text.

F86B7955AB5640E3990EF866CBDB51B4.description: Determine which piece(s) of evidence provide the strongest support for inferences, conclusions, or summaries or text.

841691C2013A40D79153536979AC4332.description: Use two or more pieces of evidence to support inferences, conclusions, or summaries or text.

E22A8A7D850A48CF8E168CB37E7F2CB6.description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly

CBEA41FE8E2A409D8378463E54B572AC.description: Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.
